2 ^ A hymn becometh thee: 3 ^ O hear my prayer~; all flesh shall come to thee.
4 ^ The words of the wicked have prevailed over us
O God: and thou wilt pardon our transgressions.

2 ^ A hymn becometh thee: 5 ^ Blessed is he whom thou hast chosen and taken to thee~; he shall dwell in thy courts. We shall be filled with the good things of thy house~; holy is thy temple

and a vow shall be paid to thee in Jeru: who art the hope of all the ends of the earth
column5: and in the sea afar off.

2 ^ A hymn becometh thee: 7 ^ Thou who preparest the mountains by thy strength
8 ^ who troublest the depth of the sea
O God: the noise of its waves. The Gentiles shall be troubled

2 ^ A hymn becometh thee: 9 ^ and they that dwell in the uttermost borders shall be afraid at thy signs~; the departures of the morning and of the evening thou shalt delight.
10 ^ Thou hast visited the earth and inebriated it~; thou hast many ways enriched it. The river of God is filled with water~; thou hast prepared their food
11 ^ Inebriate the streams thereof~; multiply its fruits~; it shall spring up and rejoice in its showers.
12 ^ Thou shalt bless the crown of the year of thy goodness
O God: and thy fields shall be filled with plenty.

2 ^ A hymn becometh thee: 13 ^ The beautiful things of the wilderness shall grow fat
O God: and the hills shall be girded about with joy.

2 ^ A hymn becometh thee: 14 ^ The rams of the flock are clothed
O God: and the vales shall abound with corn~; they shall shout
in Sion: yea they shall sing a hymn.
